title: ShotByPortable
overview: ShotByPortable is a photography portfolio website designed to showcase the work of a professional photographer specializing in headshots, lifestyle, and branding photography. The site offers a seamless experience for visitors to explore galleries, review pricing and packages, and book personalized sessions. It also includes a robust admin dashboard for the client to manage content dynamically.
challenge: The client needed a sleek, responsive platform that not only highlights their visual artistry but also simplifies the booking process and offers easy content management. They wanted the site to reflect their unique storytelling approach through visuals, while being intuitive for both visitors and administrators.
solution: I developed a modern, responsive web application that brings the photographer's creative vision to life. The main website is optimized for performance and visual storytelling, while the admin frontend gives a structure that allows the client to effortlessly update galleries, modify pricing packages, and manage bookings. The design is aligned with their brand identity, providing an immersive and professional experience for users.
outcome: The final product is a visually striking, fully functional portfolio website that empowers the client to maintain their content independently. Visitors now enjoy a smooth browsing and booking experience, and the client has received positive feedback from users for the site's aesthetic and usability. The website has become a central tool in elevating the photographer’s brand presence online.

title: AyoCPA
overview: AyoCPA is a Canadian-based accounting firm offering a full suite of financial services including accounting, bookkeeping, payroll, taxation, business advisory, and estate planning. The website was designed to reflect the firm's client-focused philosophy and commitment to modern, tech-driven solutions. It features informative sections such as About, Services, Blog, and Resources, along with essential user interactions like document submission, appointment booking, and a client portal.
challenge: The client needed a clean, professional, and responsive website that could clearly communicate their wide range of services while enabling user engagement through online document submission and multi-branch appointment scheduling. Additionally, they required intuitive navigation and accessibility for both new and returning clients, with seamless integration of key tools like a client portal.
solution: As the frontend developer, I translated the provided design into a fully responsive, user-friendly web interface using NextJS, TypeScript, AntD and Tailwind CSS. Special attention was given to accessibility, responsiveness across devices, and maintaining a professional yet approachable aesthetic. I implemented dynamic UI components to support document uploads, branch-based appointment booking, and seamless navigation through the company’s services and blog content.
outcome: The final frontend build provided AyoCPA with a polished and engaging digital presence that aligns with their mission to deliver personalized accounting services. The client now has a professional platform that facilitates customer interactions and strengthens trust with potential clients. The site has improved their online visibility and has streamlined key business operations like client onboarding and scheduling.

title: Infarena
overview: Infarena is a dynamic, multi-purpose web platform developed for users in Canada to connect, explore, and engage with their local communities. Designed as an all-in-one hub, the platform allows users to interact through discussion boards, post and browse real estate listings, upload business profiles, find job opportunities, and explore marketplace offerings—all within their specific location.
challenge: The vision behind Infarena was to simplify community integration for newcomers and residents alike. The client needed a scalable, responsive, and interactive frontend that could accommodate multiple functionalities without overwhelming the user. The challenge was creating a seamless user experience across various modules—discussion forums, listings, marketplace, job board, and more—while maintaining clarity and ease of use.
solution: I collaborated with a teammate to develope the frontend of Infarena using React, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, ensuring a clean, modular structure and consistent UI across features. I focused on intuitive navigation and responsive layout that allows users to sign in, participate in community discussions, post listings, and explore services based on their geographic location. Each feature—from real estate to job board—was treated as a focused experience within the larger ecosystem.
outcome: The result is a modern, community-driven platform that empowers users to stay informed, connected, and engaged within their locality. Infarena successfully combines multiple services under one digital roof, making it a valuable tool for individuals looking to integrate into a new area or stay updated on local opportunities. The frontend delivers a smooth, scalable experience that adapts to the evolving needs of both users and the client.

title: Wow Giftcard
overview: WowGiftCard is a secure and user-centric web platform built to simplify the process of exchanging gift cards for cash. The platform offers real-time rate calculations, instant payouts, and supports a wide range of popular gift card brands including Amazon, iTunes, Google Play, and Walmart. With a focus on user trust and transaction speed, the platform ensures a seamless experience from card submission to cash payout.
challenge: The main goal was to build a platform that feels trustworthy, responsive, and easy to navigate—while clearly communicating the value of their services.
solution: I developed the frontend using NextJS, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, with a focus on building a refined and efficient user journey. The design emphasizes clarity and accessibility, incorporating interactive components like a live rate calculator. From layout structure to visual cues, every element was crafted to support smooth navigation and prompt action.
outcome: The final product is a highly functional user interface that enhances trust and encourages engagement. The result is a polished and user-focused experience that aligns perfectly with the client’s mission to simplify gift card exchange.

title: Job Listings
overview: This project is a responsive job listing interface built to allow users to browse and filter job opportunities based on position, languages, and tools. Inspired by a Frontend Mentor design challenge, the application offers an intuitive experience where users can dynamically refine job results using multi-tag filters.
challenge: The core challenge of this project was implementing a robust filtering logic that could handle multiple overlapping criteria, particularly when filtering jobs by technologies listed as arrays (e.g., languages and tools). Achieving real-time filtering responsiveness without compromising performance required careful consideration of the algorithm structure and user interaction flow.
solution: I developed the interface using React, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, with a strong focus on state management and efficient data handling. To manage the filtering logic, I implemented a custom algorithm that checks whether each job listing matches all selected filter tags using methods like every(). Collaboration played a key role—through pair programming and targeted research, I refined the logic into a clean and maintainable solution.
outcome: The final product is a fully functional, visually cohesive job board that demonstrates advanced filtering capabilities and responsive design. This project enhanced my skills in logic structuring, component reusability, and collaborative debugging. It stands as a personal milestone in problem-solving and practical frontend development.

title: Todo Application
overview: This To-Do App is a productivity-focused task manager designed with simplicity and interactivity in mind. Inspired by a Frontend Mentor challenge, it allows users to manage their daily tasks efficiently—adding, completing, deleting, and filtering tasks based on their status. The app also features a dark/light mode toggle to enhance user comfort across environments.
challenge: Building a seamless task management experience involved handling a range of user interactions—from real-time input tracking to managing multiple task states (active, completed, all). Implementing intuitive features like keyboard shortcuts, hover effects, and dynamic filtering required thoughtful state management and user-focused design decisions.
solution: Using React, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, I developed a lightweight yet fully interactive application. Key features include: A toggle for switching between dark and light themes, Keyboard handling with onKeyDown to enhance form input interactions, Contextual UI feedback using onMouseEnter to reveal controls on hover, Robust state management using useState and functional updates to manage task arrays efficiently, and Filter controls to display All, Active, or Completed tasks.
outcome: The result is a responsive and polished task manager that delivers a smooth and intuitive user experience. This project reinforced my understanding of React’s state logic, improved my handling of conditional rendering and events, and expanded my familiarity with accessible user interface design. It’s a great example of how small applications can be powerful learning tools and showcase practical frontend skills.

title: Product List with Cart
overview: This project is a simplified e-commerce interface that allows users to interact with a product list by adding items to a cart, adjusting quantities, removing products, and confirming orders. Though built without a backend, it simulates core online shopping functionalities using client-side state and local storage for data persistence.
challenge: The goal was to mimic essential e-commerce interactions while managing all state and data within the browser. The key challenge was handling cart updates in a way that felt responsive and realistic—without relying on server-side logic or database calls. Ensuring persistence across page refreshes was also crucial to emulate a user-friendly shopping experience.
solution: I built the interface using React, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, leveraging localStorage to persist cart data across sessions. The project includes: Dynamic product display and interaction, Real-time cart updates including quantity increase/decrease and item removal, Order confirmation logic to simulate a checkout experience, and State synchronization with localStorage to ensure user data is retained even after reload.
outcome: The result is a lightweight, intuitive product listing and cart system that demonstrates foundational e-commerce functionality using only frontend technologies. This project strengthened my understanding of state persistence, array manipulation, and UI feedback loops, while also highlighting the power of localStorage in client-side development.

title: REST Countries API
overview: This project is a responsive and interactive frontend application that consumes the REST Countries API to display data about countries around the world. It features a clean layout with dark and light mode toggling, a search bar for locating countries by name, and a region-based filter to narrow down results. Users can also click into each country card to view a detailed dynamic page with more information such as population, capital, subregion, languages, currencies, and bordering countries.
challenge: While the user interface itself appears straightforward, implementing real-time filtering and routing to dynamically generated pages required careful data handling and navigation logic. Filtering results simultaneously based on user input and region selection was especially tricky, as it involved chaining and reapplying multiple filters in a predictable, user-friendly manner.
solution: Built using Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, the application leverages client-side routing to generate dynamic pages for each country using the Next.js app router. For interactivity and responsiveness, it uses search parameters and router hooks like useRouter and useSearchParams to update and access filter states in real-time. Theme toggling was implemented using state management and Tailwind’s dark mode configuration, allowing users to easily switch between light and dark viewing preferences.
outcome: The project successfully delivers an educational and smooth user experience, showcasing how data-rich APIs can be paired with modern frontend frameworks to build engaging applications. It deepened my understanding of Next.js routing, search parameter handling, and dynamic page rendering while sharpening my approach to building scalable filter logic and theme switching functionality.
